primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transformation of the hearer's life-focus from transcendental security (eternal life) to concrete social action (mercy) through the pedagogical 'zinger' of Jesus.

tekstueel_bewijs: “What must I do to inherit eternal life?”
YOU can do what you need to get real life.
Faith means letting the subject of our life be changed
The answer at the end is: Mercy.
uncommon action, action that violates our social role
Jesus has a way of shifting the subject
Good pedagogy fixes it so that the student can answer her own question
invest on behalf of those who have no claim upon us
recast all of life around the one who 'holds all things together'
The story functions to change the subject
The story in the midst of the frame is on the way
helper.rol_van_god: Absent (Jesus is a functional storyteller/helper, not the primary actor)

tekstueel_bewijs: Our unfaith is a refusal to have the subject of our life changed
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opposition is framed as a lack of willingness to change one's schedule or identity, rather than an ontological or spiritual bondage.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: There is no distinct soteriological program where God acts; the ethical program is the only active narrative.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: n/a
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon explicitly dismisses the 'eternal life' (soteriological) question to focus on the 'mercy' (ethical) task.

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus has a way of shifting the subject
voorbeelden_mens_subject: YOU can do what you need
The asker wants to waste nothing

voorbeelden: you had better ask while you have the chance
the asker wants to waste nothing
letting the subject of our life be changed
Good pedagogy fixes it so that the student can answer her own question
Jesus is not a burdened theologian... so he echoes Moses: 'You can do it.'

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon assumes the hearer possesses the power (Pouvoir) and merely needs the obligation (Devoir) and the knowledge (Savoir) to act.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Eternal Life) to ~S2 (Brutality) to S1 (Mercy).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by abandoning S2 as 'taking care of itself' in favor of S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Low. Eternal life is described as an 'oxymoron' or 'transcendentalism' that distracts from the real work.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is anthropocentric. It positions the human hearer as the primary subject of the verbs of action and reduces Jesus to a 'pedagogue' or 'storyteller' who facilitates human self-actualization.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus... echoes Moses: 'You can do it.'
The gospel does not much linger over eternal Life, which will take care of itself.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: recast all of life around the one who 'holds all things together.'

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Samaritan is used as a model of 'uncommon action' and 'outrageous cost' for the hearer to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ is the Samaritan who finds the hearer half-dead on the road and saves them at His own cost.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Inspiration followed by potential exhaustion (burden of 'Do it').
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is equated with ethical performance.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is rhetorically coherent but theologically fragmented, as it severs the link between the gift of life and the call to mercy.
spanning_punten: The claim that Jesus 'never settles for frivolous questions' vs the claim that 'eternal life... will take care of itself.'

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus' story changes our life-question by... inviting us to uncommon action.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The hearer is assumed to already have the competence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'routine' or 'social roles' rather than a condition requiring a Savior.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a recruitment speech for ethical living, where Jesus is the coach and the hearer is the athlete. God is not an actant in the primary drama.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of 'doing mercy' to earn or manifest life.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Jesus must be the Subject who shows mercy to the hearer (the man in the ditch).
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'You can do it,' say 'Christ has done for you what you could not do for yourself, becoming the neighbor you refused to be.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the wounded man in the ditch (Receiver).
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the hearer's inability to save themselves from the 'brutality' mentioned.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (Grace as the power to act).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Spirit empowers the heart to love, rather than just commanding the hand to move.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify Sin as a power that prevents us from being 'good' neighbors.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a heavy opponent, the 'Helper' (Grace) is unnecessary.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Proclaim the mercy of God (Soteriology) as the ground for the human act of mercy (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a strong rhetorical 'zinger' but lacks the 'Good News' that empowers the hearer to actually live out the summons.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is engaging and clever; semiotically, it is a legalistic engine.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical Samaritan-Jewish tension; Greimas shows the functional displacement of God by the human subject.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite using the name 'Jesus,' the narrative structure is entirely secular/humanistic.

appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly rejects the 'burdened theologian' perspective, which is a meta-discursive move to avoid the 'Pouvoir' (Grace) problem.
